lead_paragraph: In a rare rebuke, Egypt’s highest Muslim religious authority refused to approve court-ordered death sentences on leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood, court officials said.
abstract: Shawqi Allam, Egypt’s highest Muslim religious authority, refuses to approve court-ordered death sentences on leaders of the Muslim Brotherhood, including Mohamed Badie and others who were convicting of inciting murder in Cairo in 2013; says case lacks evidence.

snippet: As Secretary of State John Kerry received broad assurances but no public commitments from Egypt as he tried to assemble a coalition to fight ISIS, Australia on Sunday committed aircraft and military advisers to the effort.
lead_paragraph: As Secretary of State John Kerry received broad assurances but no public commitments from Egypt as he tried to assemble a coalition to fight ISIS, Australia on Sunday committed aircraft and military advisers to the effort.
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry receives broad assurances but no public commitments from Egypt as he continues his tour of the Middle East to try to assemble a coalition behind American campaign against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; Obama administration seeks to enlist support from regional powers with Sunni Muslim majorities to avoid impression that United States is intervening in a sectarian war on behalf of the Shiite-dominated Iraqi government..

headline.main: Kerry Scours Mideast for Aid in ISIS Fight

abstract: Memo From Cairo; Egyptian Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi returns from first visit to United Nations to widespread acclaim; Egyptians perceive Sisi's UN address as transformational moment in which he was accepted as a legitimate statesman by the international community; Sisi has consolidated exceptional control in his home country, building a cult of personality and capitalizing on fear of the chaos that has engulfed surrounding countries.

abstract: Israeli and Palestinian leaders reach open-ended cease-fire agreement that promises only limited change to conditions in Gaza and leaves broader issues underpinning the conflict unresolved; Hamas declared victory even though it abandoned most of its demands, accepting Egyptian-brokered deal that differed little from one proffered on battle's seventh day.

abstract: Return of United States to Middle East three years after withdrawing from Iraq is getting a less than enthusiastic welcome among Arab nations; leading allies like Egypt, Jordan and Turkey are all finding ways to avoid specific commitments to Pres Obama's expanded effort against Islamic State in Iraq and Syria; thirteen years of chaos have deepened political and sectarian divisions and increased mistrust of US on all sides.

abstract: Hostilities between Israel and Palestinian militants in Gaza Strip resume after brief one-sided cease-fire generated by Egypt; Israelis scramble for shelter as more than 100 rockets descend on them and country retaliates with airstrikes that pound tunnels and rocket launchers in Gaza; Egypt's failed effort to halt hostilities reveals crucial differences from previous go-rounds that experts say make a resolution much more complicated to achieve.

headline.main: After Brief Lull in Gaza Crisis, Airstrikes Resume
headline.print_headline: Brief Lull Ends in Gaza Crisis; Strikes Resume

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kareem Fahim in Cairo; Fares Akram in Gaza; Rina Castelnuovo in Ashdod, Israel; Sebnem Arsu in Istanbul; Gabby Sobelman and Myra Noveck in Jerusalem; and Michael R. Gordon in Vienna.

snippet: The governments were accused of dithering at critical moments, and at one point, Egypt even blamed Hamas, rather than Israel, for dozens of Palestinian deaths.
lead_paragraph: The governments were accused of dithering at critical moments, and at one point, Egypt even blamed Hamas, rather than Israel, for dozens of Palestinian deaths.
abstract: Palestinians are surprised by the lack of support from Arab nations during the recent Israeli military offensive, and some Palestinian supporters even say Arab reaction is at times providing cover for the Israeli military assault; Egypt has even blamed Hamas, rather than Israel, for dozens of Palestinian deaths.

headline.main: Palestinians Find Show of Support Lacking From Arab Leaders Amid Offensive
headline.print_headline: Palestinians Find Show of Support Lacking From Arab Leaders Amid Offensive

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

byline.contributor: Asma Al Zohairy contributed reporting from Cairo, Farah Samti from Tunis, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon.
